6a5fcc89-fe08-44b8-b920-7b98cdcc58ca.description: This course is designed to explore and evaluate corporate communication in alignment to their strategic goals. Earners of this badge will be able to interpret and apply the Corporate Communication Strategic Planning Model, and develop comprehensive communication plans.
6a5fcc89-fe08-44b8-b920-7b98cdcc58ca.name: Disney Corporate Communication Course (WALT-0011)(v.3)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be part of the Disney College or International Program.
Methods of assessment include written papers, presentations, case studies, performance rubrics (checklists), case studies, and Kolb Learning Styles Profile with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

4b02de23-5441-4d05-a9a0-a604de19dcb2.description: This course is designed to examine the universal principles of leadership. The earner will be able to examine, inform, and apply academic models of leadership and understand how it is applied within a corporate setting.
4b02de23-5441-4d05-a9a0-a604de19dcb2.name: Disney Organizational Leadership Course (WALT-0007)(v.5)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be part of the Disney College or International Program.
Methods of assessment include quizzes, written papers, presentations, performance rubrics (checklists), examinations, and case studies with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

5a9293aa-c30c-4e97-be68-5d7d8fd47404.description: This advanced-level course combines theory and experiential assignments to understand the main concepts of creativity and innovation. The earner of this badge has greater understanding of and appreciation for the process and designs an innovation, product, process or service utilizing the key aspects of creativity and innovation.
5a9293aa-c30c-4e97-be68-5d7d8fd47404.name: Disney Creativity and Innovation Course (WALT-0012)(v.3)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be part of the Disney College or International Program.
Methods of assessment include quizzes, written papers, presentations, performance rubrics (checklists), examinations, and case studies with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
Design an innovation, product, process or service utilizing key aspects of the innovative process.

2de86b3e-7b35-4f43-80f3-4adc60d59d08.description: The course is designed to explore the human resource management function in a corporate setting. The earner of this badge understands the principles of human resources, including people management laws, practices, ethics and globalization.
2de86b3e-7b35-4f43-80f3-4adc60d59d08.name: Disney Human Resource Management Course (WALT-0005)(v.4)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be part of the Disney College or International Program.
Methods of assessment include quizzes, written papers, presentations, performance rubrics (checklists), examinations, and case studies with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

b88e5aeb-3200-413a-86e1-94537eb17284.description: This advanced-level course covers complex issues facing Hospitality leaders today by exposing them to contemporary operational issues and situations. Earners of this badge develop strategic solutions as part of a comprehensive business plan.
b88e5aeb-3200-413a-86e1-94537eb17284.name: Disney Advanced Studies in Hospitality Management Course (WALT-0010)(v.3)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be part of the Disney College or International Program.
Methods of assessment include quizzes, written papers, presentations, performance rubrics (checklists), examinations, and case studies with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
Construct a comprehensive business plan that includes financial, human resource, marketing, event planning and crisis response data.

585bd28c-a75a-4e7c-a0e8-84d1244e149a.description: The course is designed to provide an organizational exploration of The Walt Disney Company and cover a variety of topics including its corporate history, structure, governance, performance, and culture. The earner of this badge understands the unique context and culture of The Walt Disney Company.
585bd28c-a75a-4e7c-a0e8-84d1244e149a.name: Disney Corporate Analysis Course (WALT-0001)(v.4)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be part of the Disney College or International Program.
Methods of assessment include quizzes, written papers, presentations, performance rubrics (checklists), examinations, and case studies with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

f8f118ad-96a3-4cb0-9a5a-6e1699cb6440.description: This course is a comprehensive program designed to address the professional and career development needs for a successful transition to the competitive job market. The earner of this badge understands their career focus and develops a four-step professional strategy to achieve their professional career goals.
f8f118ad-96a3-4cb0-9a5a-6e1699cb6440.name: Disney Marketing You Course (WALT-0009)(v.4)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be part of the Disney College or International Program.
Methods of assessment include quizzes, written papers, presentations, performance rubrics (checklists), examinations, and case studies with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

9b9ebc63-c3be-4550-8180-90d4028a3934.description: This course is designed as a blended course, combining traditional classroom education with out-of-class learning opportunities. Earners engage in group and individual learning activities to expand their knowledge and understanding of fundamental elements such as communication, partnerships, and responsibility as they part of a successful business strategy
9b9ebc63-c3be-4550-8180-90d4028a3934.name: Disney Interactive Learning Program (WALT-0008)(v.5)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be part of the Disney College or International Program.
Methods of assessment include written papers, presentations, case studies, performance rubrics (checklists), case studies, and Kolb Learning Styles Profile with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

3c7604ac-6ca7-4db3-980d-d4598d496479.description: This course is designed to provide academic classroom education with a variety of self-directed learning opportunities. The earner has a fundamental understanding of theories of adult learning, experiential learning, learning organizations, and conversational learning. The earner can identify a variety of learning styles and experiences to develop an understanding of their learning preferences.
3c7604ac-6ca7-4db3-980d-d4598d496479.name: Disney Experiential Learning (WALT-0003)(v.5)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must be part of the Disney College or International Program.
Methods of assessment include written papers, presentations, case studies, performance rubrics (checklists), case studies, and Kolb Learning Styles Profile with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

a26bd810-0303-4001-a4a8-289fa599fc16.description: Participants in the 6-month Disney College & International Program Internship obtain valuable work experience and reflection by incorporating the learning experiences noted in the AACSB's Assurance of Learning Standards Report (2007) as well as utilizing the transferable skills noted in the Secretary of Labor's SCANS report. The Disney College & International Program is defined as supervised employment extending classroom based occupational learning at on-the-job learning stations.
a26bd810-0303-4001-a4a8-289fa599fc16.name: Disney College & International Program Internship (v3 6 credits)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of instruction include audio visual materials; case studies; classroom exercises; computer-based training; discussions; lectures; and practical exercises.

The methods of assessment include performance rubrics and knowledge assessment: a multiple-choice assessment is given to cast member's which must be completed with an 80% accuracy. This assessment can be used in the place of the performance rubric.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 6 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

e713b8b2-d72c-44d7-96dd-d6b5bf414e74.description: Participants in the 9 or 12-month Disney College & International Program Internship obtain valuable work experience and reflection by incorporating the learning experiences noted in the AACSB's Assurance of Learning Standards Report (2007) as well as utilizing the transferable skills noted in the Secretary of Labor's SCANS report. The Disney College & International Program is defined as supervised employment extending classroom based occupational learning at on-the-job learning stations.
e713b8b2-d72c-44d7-96dd-d6b5bf414e74.name: Disney College & International Program Internship (v3 9 credits)

The methods of assessment include performance rubrics and knowledge assessment: a multiple-choice assessment is given to cast member's which must be completed with an 80% accuracy. This assessment can be used in the place of the performance rubric.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 9 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

5759b2ef-4fe2-43c4-83c2-bfc440625091.description: Participants in the 3-month Disney College & International Program Internship obtain valuable work experience and reflection by incorporating the learning experiences noted in the AACSB's Assurance of Learning Standards Report (2007) as well as utilizing the transferable skills noted in the Secretary of Labor's SCANS report. The Disney College & International Program is defined as supervised employment extending classroom based occupational learning at on-the-job learning stations.
5759b2ef-4fe2-43c4-83c2-bfc440625091.name: Disney College & International Program Internship (v3 3 credits)
